page.title: 06Annual Events in Ripe
page.content: Christmas is even more friendly and inviting. It is an old custom for the village children to come to the church bringing a present, for a deprived child, which they place on the Altar steps. Carols are sung and a short talk is given, usually by the Bishop of Lewes. Afterwards all the children walk back to the village centre with lanterns to be greeted by Father Christmas. By the christmas tree Father Christmas gives each child a present. Mince pies are served and the Lamb Inn is packed out. Carols are rung by the hand bell ringers of Ripe. Some poeple stay up to attend the candle lit Midnight Service of Holy Communion. The bell ringers go absolutely mad on New Years Eve, and at midnight the villagers dance around the christmas tree.
